column4: logcat is a terminal command i can type on my phone to see what is going on in the system via a live output in the terminal window
is there a "logcat" for ubuntu?  i'd like to find one, so I can look and see what's going on if that problem happens again
logcat? you can view all the logs that are made either via log file viewer under system, or in /var/log.
a command line utility to view the last X lines of a text file.
